definitions.definition: A voting booth.
A negative balance of trade.
A public building housing courts of law.
The public building where most American counties have their county offices.
Obstinately adhering to one's own opinion.
An erroneous cast or reckoning.
To cast or reckon incorrectly.
To cast or direct erroneously or improperly.
definitions.example: to miscast a glance

definitions.definition: To cast an actor in an inappropriate role.
To make an error when casting a vote.
Erroneously cast
The theory/science of communication and control in the animal and the machine.
The art/study of governing, controlling automatic processes and communication.
Technology related to computers and Internet.
The process or result of being gradually decomposed.
A deterioration of condition; loss of status or fortune.
To deteriorate, to get worse, to lose strength or health, to decline in quality.
definitions.example: The pair loved to take pictures in the decaying hospital on forty-third street.

definitions.definition: (of organic material) To rot, to go bad.
definitions.example: The cat's body decayed rapidly.

definitions.definition: (of an unstable atom) To change by undergoing fission, by emitting radiation, or by capturing or losing one or more electrons.
(of a quantum system) To undergo optical decay, that is, to relax to a less excited state, usually by emitting a photon or phonon.
Loss of airspeed due to drag.
To cause to rot or deteriorate.
definitions.example: The extreme humidity decayed the wooden sculptures in the museum's collection in a matter of years.

definitions.definition: Any of several omnivorous mammals, of the genus Nasua or Nasuella, in order Carnivora, that live in the range from southern United States to northern Argentina.
The period around Christmas; the Christmas season, Christmastime; specifically, Christmas itself.

(dated, or Germanic Neo-Paganism) The period of celebration of a pre-Christian festival associated with the (northern) winter solstice, later absorbed into the festival of Christmas (but sometimes recreated by modern neo-pagans).
The period of southern winter in the middle of the year, sometimes celebrated in the colder, snowy regions of Australia with allusions to Christmas, which originated as a marketing gimmick.
The flower Camellia sasanqua, native to Japan and nearby islands.
A rig, consisting of platform and machinery, used to drill for oil and other petroleum products like natural gas.
A composition for nine instruments or nine voices.
A group of nine nuclear or subatomic particles.
A byte of nine bits.
A young woman or girl.
definitions.example: Come and dance, ye lads and lasses!

definitions.definition: (Mackem) A sweetheart.
A construction with a tablelike surface, placed outdoors to supply food to birds.
Deliberately act in a way that's likely to lead to a fight.
definitions.example: When they showed up, you could tell they were looking for trouble

definitions.definition: Do things that are likely to cause problems.
definitions.example: If you cut corners on maintenance now, you're just looking for trouble later on.

definitions.definition: A writer of an advice column in a newspaper or other periodical.
definitions.example: You should write in to the agony aunt; she'll sort it out for you.

definitions.definition: Someone commonly consulted for advice about personal problems.
definitions.example: I'm sick of everyone coming to me with their problems - I never wanted to be an agony aunt!

definitions.definition: Somebody suffering from anorexia nervosa.
A medicine which suppresses appetite.
Pertaining to, or suffering from anorexia nervosa.
(by extension) Thin, skinny.
Of or pertaining to scripture.
Also more fully as Juneteenth Day: a holiday celebrated in many states of the United States of America on June 19, commemorating the end of slavery.
A mournful poem or piece of music composed or performed as a memorial to a dead person.
A song or piece of music that is considered too slow, bland or boring.
To sing dirges
The violent, criminal acts that are associated with thugs, and/or the fashion, manner of speaking, and demeanor associated with them.
Impure carbon obtained by destructive distillation of wood or other organic matter, that is to say, heating it in the absence of oxygen.
A stick of black carbon material used for drawing.
A drawing made with charcoal.
A very dark gray colour.
To draw with charcoal.
To cook over charcoal.
Of a dark gray colour.
Made of charcoal.
To relocate production, services or jobs to lower-cost locations in the same country.
Moving from the sea towards the land: an onshore breeze
Positioned on or near the shore
Within the country; not overseas.
From the sea towards the land
Coarse grains produced at an intermediate stage of wheat flour milling.
Such grains, usually from hard wheat, used in the preparation of pasta, couscous and various sweet dishes.
A soft dessert made by boiling a mixture of semolina, sugar and flavourings in milk.
The slow movement of continents explained by plate tectonics.
A coward.
To make craven.
Unwilling to fight; lacking even the rudiments of courage; extremely cowardly.
Academic discipline that deals with the content, history, meaning and effects of various media, in particular mass media.
To swim under water.
To jump into water head-first.
To jump headfirst toward the ground or into another substance.
definitions.example: to dive into home plate

definitions.definition: To descend sharply or steeply.
(especially with in) To undertake with enthusiasm.
definitions.example: She dove right in and started making improvements.

definitions.definition: To deliberately fall down after a challenge, imitating being fouled, in the hope of getting one's opponent penalised.
To cause to descend, dunk; to plunge something into water.
To explore by diving; to plunge into.
To plunge or to go deeply into any subject, question, business, etc.; to penetrate; to explore.
The action of the verb to dive in any sense.
The sport of jumping into water, often acrobatically.
Descending below the surface of the water to interact with the environment.
The act of pretending to be tripped or brought to the ground by an opposition player in order to secure a undeserved penalty.
That or who dives or dive.
A substance topically applied to the lips of the mouth to relieve chapped or dry lips, angular cheilitis or stomatitis, and cold sores.
Surrounded with a moat
A mechanical device consisting of a handgrip mounted on a base or pedestal and typically having one or more buttons, used to control an aircraft, computer or other equipment.
A penis.
To manoeuvre by means of a joystick.
Protuberance, air pressure
To swell; protuberate; bulge or spread out.
(originally said of fowl) To stand or walk stiffly, with the tail erect and spread out.
To walk proudly or haughtily.
definitions.example: He strutted about the yard, thinking himself master of all he surveyed.

definitions.definition: To cause to swell; enlarge; give more importance to.
To protrude; cause to bulge.
A proud step or walk, with the head erect; affected dignity in walking.
Swelling out; protuberant; bulging.
A support rod.
An instrument for adjusting the pleats of a ruff.
To brace or support by a strut or struts; hold in place or strengthen by an upright, diagonal, or transverse support.
Alternative spelling of drive time
A unit of length (abbreviation ly; equal to just under 10 trillion kilometres (1016 metres)) equal to the distance light travels in one Julian year; used to measure extremely large distances.
(only in plural) A very long way.
definitions.example: The marathon runner in the lead is light years ahead of the one at the back.

definitions.definition: (only in plural) A very long time.
definitions.example: Some of Leonardo da Vinci’s inventions were light years ahead of their time.

definitions.definition: The local office in which births, marriages and deaths are registered, and in which civil marriages are conducted and recorded.
An employment office.
(of a person) To be in a position in which the upper body is upright and supported by the buttocks.
definitions.example: After a long day of walking, it was good just to sit and relax.

definitions.definition: (of a person) To move oneself into such a position.
definitions.example: I asked him to sit.

definitions.definition: (of an object) To occupy a given position permanently.
definitions.example: The temple has sat atop that hill for centuries.

definitions.definition: To remain in a state of repose; to rest; to abide; to rest in any position or condition.
To be a member of a deliberative body.
definitions.example: I currently sit on a standards committee.

definitions.definition: Of a legislative or, especially, a judicial body such as a court, to be in session.
definitions.example: In what city is the circuit court sitting for this session.

definitions.definition: To lie, rest, or bear; to press or weigh.
To be adjusted; to fit.
definitions.example: Your new coat sits well.

definitions.definition: (of an agreement or arrangement) To be accepted or acceptable; to work.
definitions.example: How will this new contract sit with the workers?

definitions.definition: (causative) To cause to be seated or in a sitting posture; to furnish a seat to.
definitions.example: Sit him in front of the TV and he might watch for hours.

definitions.definition: To accommodate in seats; to seat.
definitions.example: The dining room table sits eight comfortably.

definitions.definition: To babysit.
definitions.example: I need to find someone to sit my kids on Friday evening for four hours.

definitions.definition: To take, to undergo or complete (an examination or test).
To cover and warm eggs for hatching, as a fowl; to brood; to incubate.
To take a position for the purpose of having some artistic representation of oneself made, such as a picture or a bust.
definitions.example: I'm sitting for a painter this evening.

definitions.definition: To have position, as at the point blown from; to hold a relative position; to have direction.
A moon or other smaller body orbiting a larger one.
definitions.example: A spent upper stage is a derelict satellite.

definitions.definition: A man-made apparatus designed to be placed in orbit around a celestial body, generally to relay information, data etc. to Earth.
definitions.example: Many telecommunication satellites orbit at 36000km above the equator.

definitions.definition: A country, state, office, building etc. which is under the jurisdiction, influence, or domination of another body.
An attendant on an important person; a member of someone's retinue, often in a somewhat derogatory sense; a henchman.
Satellite TV; reception of television broadcasts via services that utilize man-made satellite technology.
definitions.example: Do you have satellite at your house?

definitions.definition: (grammar) A grammatical construct that takes various forms and may encode a path of movement, a change of state, or the grammatical aspect. Examples: "a bird flew past"; "she turned on the light".
The tube that carries food from the pharynx to the stomach.
A person who holds to a form of agnosticism, especially uncertainty of the existence of a deity.
Of or relating to agnosticism or its adherents.
definitions.example: His agnostic viewpoint is summarized in his book.

definitions.definition: Doubtful or uncertain about the existence or demonstrability of God or other deity.
definitions.example: She left the church when she became agnostic.

definitions.definition: Of a software component etc.: unaware or noncommittal regarding the specific nature of the components or input with which it interacts.
definitions.example: The socket communications layer is agnostic with regard to its underlying transport mechanism -- it is “transport-agnostic”.

definitions.definition: (usually with a prepositional phrase) Having no firmly held opinions on an issue or matter of uncertainty.
definitions.example: He says he's agnostic concerning the Secretary's claims.

definitions.definition: A machine, building or company used for cutting (milling) lumber.
definitions.example: He brought his portable sawmill and turned the old beams into interesting flooring.

definitions.definition: To process (lumber) in a sawmill.
Any turtle that inhabits oceans.
A vesicant gas, bis (2-chloroethyl) sulfide, (ClC2H4)2S, once used in chemical warfare.
definitions.example: The man who survived mustard gas and pepper spray is now a seasoned veteran.

definitions.definition: A shared lounge found in dormitories, universities, military bases, etc.
For either a win or a place in a competition.
For either a win or a place in a competition.
A small fighting force specially trained for making quick destructive raids against enemy-held areas.
A commando trooper
An organized force of Boer troops in South Africa; a raid by such troops
A number expressed in the base-ten system, a fractional numeral written in this system.
The decimal system itself.
A decimal place.
definitions.example: Pi has a value of 3.142, to three decimals.

definitions.definition: A decimal point.
To represent with numbers after a decimal point
Concerning numbers expressed in decimal or mathematical calculations performed using decimal.
An infant that is still being breastfed (being suckled) by its mother.
A young mammal not yet weaned and still being fed milk by its mother.
To give suck to; to nurse at the breast, udder, or dugs.
To nurse; to suck milk from a nursing mother.
To nurse from (a breast, nursing mother, etc.).
A room in a business set aside for the display of the company's products.
A room or apartment where a show is exhibited.
To inspect merchandise in a physical store, then purchase the identical product from an online merchant; to use a physical store as a showroom for an online merchant.
definitions.example: This new phone looks good, but I want to go to the mall and showroom it before buying.

definitions.definition: An organelle found in the cells of green plants, and in photosynthetic algae, where photosynthesis takes place.

A crude incendiary bomb made from a glass bottle, either filled with a flammable liquid such as petroleum and supplied with a rag for a fuse that is lit just before being hurled, or filled with such a mix of flammable liquids that it ignites itself when it is smashed and its contents are exposed to air.
A precaution.
Of, pertaining to, or serving as a precaution

A form of gambling (or investment) in which a bookmaker (or broker) predicts a range of outcomes (or share price movements) and the better (or investor) places a stake on a higher or lower result and thus wins or loses a multiple of that stake, the multiple depending on the accuracy of the prediction
A kick made by dropping the ball on the ground and kicking it as it bounces up.
An insignificant, contemptible or unfashionable person; a loser; used as a general insult.
To drop (a ball) and kick it after it hits the ground.
Abbreviation of penny; pence.
Proton
One of the many pieces of paper bound together within a book or similar document.
One side of a paper leaf on which one has written or printed.
Any record or writing; a collective memory.

definitions.definition: The type set up for printing a page.
A screenful of text and possibly other content.
A web page.
A block of contiguous memory of a fixed length.
A serving boy – a youth attending a person of high degree, especially at courts, as a position of honor and education.
A youth employed for doing errands, waiting on the door, and similar service in households.
A boy or girl employed to wait upon the members of a legislative body.
(in libraries) The common name given to an employee whose main purpose is to replace materials that have either been checked out or otherwise moved, back to their shelves.
A boy child.
A contrivance, as a band, pin, snap, or the like, to hold the skirt of a woman’s dress from the ground.
A track along which pallets carrying newly molded bricks are conveyed to the hack.
A message sent to someone's pager.
Any one of several species of colorful South American moths of the genus Urania.
For each.
definitions.example: $2.50 per dozen

definitions.definition: To each, in each (used in expressing ratios of units).
definitions.example: 100 centimeters per meter

definitions.definition: By the, by means of the, via the, through the.
definitions.example: Introduce the endoscope per nasum.

definitions.definition: In accordance with.
definitions.example: I parked my car at the curb per your request.

definitions.definition: After; especially after a significant event that has long-term ramifications.
Somewhat, fairly, quite; sometimes also (by meiosis) very.
Prettily, in a pretty manner.
To decorate with fringe or embroidered edge
definitions.example: Needlework purled with gold.

definitions.definition: An inverted stitch producing ribbing etc
definitions.example: Knit one, purl two.

definitions.definition: To upset, to spin, capsize, fall heavily, fall headlong.
definitions.example: The huntsman was purled from his horse.

definitions.definition: To flow with a murmuring sound in swirls and eddies.
To rise in circles, ripples, or undulations; to curl; to mantle.
A person or a company that vends or sells.
A vending machine.
To bundle third-party dependencies with the source code for one's own program.
definitions.example: I distributed my application with a vendored copy of Perl so that it wouldn't use the system copies of Perl where it is installed.

definitions.definition: As the software vendor, to bundle one's own, possibly modified version of dependencies with a standard program.
definitions.example: Strawberry Perl contains vendored copies of some CPAN modules, designed to allow them to run on Windows.

definitions.definition: (authorship) A long speech by one person in a play; sometimes a soliloquy; other times spoken to other characters.
A long series of comic stories and jokes as an entertainment.
A long, uninterrupted utterance that monopolizes a conversation.
To deliver a monologue.
A flowering plant of the genus Primula.
A plant of the family Primulaceae.
A plant of the genus Oenothera, better known as an evening primrose.
A flower of a primrose plant.
A light yellow colour.
To pick primroses.
definitions.example: We went primrosing on Sunday and returned with a full basket.

definitions.definition: Of a light yellow colour.
The husband of one's child.
Education beyond compulsory schooling, not including university-based higher education.
Something that thrills.
A suspenseful, sensational genre of story, book, play or film.
One's spouse's father.
A stepfather.
Sound produced from opening a previously closed oral passage.
Produced from opening a previously closed oral passage.
A small cafeteria or snack bar, especially one in a military establishment, school, or place of work.
A temporary or mobile café used in an emergency or on a film location etc.
A box with compartments for storing eating utensils, silverware etc.
A military mess kit.
A water bottle used by a soldier or camper.
Any government and all entities that are controlled or funded by it.
Of or relating to a public sector.
Something that is not compulsory, especially part of an academic course.
(sometimes capitalized) In various programming languages, a kind of variable that is assigned a specific data type but may or may not hold an actual value.
Not compulsory; left to personal choice; elective.
definitions.example: On that beach clothing is entirely optional.

definitions.definition: The removable rigid roof of a convertible or sports car.
A car with such a roof.
An indoor cinema with a roof, as opposed to a drive-in.
A single unborn offspring at any stage of gestation.
Unborn offspring collectively.
definitions.example: Inheritance law allows property to be left to the unborn.

definitions.definition: Not yet born; yet to come; future.
Not yet delivered; still existing in the mother's womb.
Existing without birth or beginning.
A division in altitude (or latitude) above which trees tend not to grow on mountains.
A product that is chosen by more consumers than any of its competitors.
A company that manufactures or markets a market leader or that outsells all other similar businesses.
A column of rising air in the lower atmosphere created by uneven heating of Earth's surface.
(stone) To create a rough finish on stone by treating it with a high-temperature blow-torch.
(gliding, often in the present participle) To fly an unpowered aircraft in a (thermal) column of rising air.
Pertaining to heat or temperature.
(fabric) Providing efficient insulation so as to keep the body warm.
Caused or brought about by heat.
(stone) Having a rough finish by treatment with a blow-torch.
To compliment someone, often insincerely and sometimes to win favour.
To enhance someone's vanity by praising them.
To portray someone to advantage.
definitions.example: Her portrait flatters her.

definitions.definition: To encourage or cheer someone with (usually false) hope.
The action of the verb to flatter.
Instances of flattery.
Attractive or good-looking; that makes one look good
definitions.example: The dress really did not look very flattering on her figure.

definitions.definition: A flat gong (without knob) that is struck with a felt-covered hammer.
The male of the domesticated cat.
The male of the turkey.
The male of the orangutan.
The male of certain other animals.
Prostitutes
A lesbian.
The jack of trumps in the card game gleek.
A close-stool.
A small joined pair of drums, beaten with the hands.
(usually as a pair) Any cylindrical drum, with no snare; part of a drum kit.
A tomato (the fruit).

definitions.definition: Jewellery
(of a black person) To act in an obsequiously servile manner toward white authority.
To dig out a hole below the hatch cover of a bulker and fill it with cargo or weights to aid stability.

A progressive decline in cognitive function due to damage or disease in the brain beyond what might be expected from normal aging. Areas particularly affected include memory, attention, judgement, language and problem solving.
Madness or insanity.
A chair with supports for the arms or elbows.
To create based on theory or general knowledge rather than data.
To theorize based on analysis of data that was gathered previously; to reflect.
Remote from actual involvement, including a person retired from previously active involvement.
definitions.example: These days I'm an armchair detective.

definitions.definition: Unqualified or uninformed but yet giving advice, especially on technical issues, such as law, architecture, medicine, military theory, or sports.
definitions.example: After the American football game, the armchair quarterbacks talked about what they would have done differently to win, if they had been star athletes instead of out-of-shape old men.

definitions.definition: A person employed to maintain the game for hunting and all associated materials and effects. Often shortened to keeper.

Any of several hemiparasitic evergreen plants of the order Santalales with white berries that grow in the crowns of apple trees, oaks, and other trees, such as the European mistletoe (Viscum album) and American mistletoe or eastern mistletoe (Phoradendron leucarpum).
A sprig of one such plant used as a Christmas decoration, associated with the custom that a man may kiss any woman standing beneath it.
A term used to characterize a person or thing.
A term used as a descriptive substitute for the name or title of a person.
One of many formulaic words or phrases used in the Iliad and Odyssey to characterize a person, a group of people, or a thing.
An abusive or contemptuous word or phrase.

A word in the scientific name of a taxon following the name of the genus or species. This applies only to formal names of plants, fungi and bacteria. In formal names of animals the corresponding term is the specific name.
To term; to refer to as.
definitions.example: He was epitheted "the king of fools".

definitions.definition: To become detached.
definitions.example: One of the wagon wheels came off.

definitions.definition: To have some success; to succeed.
definitions.example: He tried his Chaplin impression, but it didn't really come off.

definitions.definition: To have an orgasm.
To appear; to seem; to project a certain quality.
definitions.example: I'm sorry if I came off as condescending; that wasn't my intention.

definitions.definition: To escape or get off (lightly, etc.); to come out of a situation without significant harm.
To come away (from a place); to leave.
A South American mammal of the camel family, Lama glama, used as a domestic beast of burden and a source of wool and meat.

Any of two or more forms of an element where the atoms have the same number of protons, but a different number of neutrons within their nuclei. As a consequence, atoms of isotopes will have the same atomic number but a different mass number.
To define or demonstrate an isotopy of (one map with another).
The northern section of a state.
Of the northern section of a state.
definitions.example: They went hunting in upstate New York.

definitions.definition: To the northern section of a state.
definitions.example: He drove upstate to visit his mother.

definitions.definition: To separate oneself from a person or situation.
definitions.example: After the scandal, the political party disassociated itself from the questionable candidate.

definitions.definition: To separate into smaller discrete units.
definitions.example: The problem is easier to understand if you disassociate the variables.

definitions.definition: To separate from related items.
definitions.example: The fabric of the coat disassociated when I washed it.

definitions.definition: To swing at the ball as hard as possible, with the aim of getting a home run, increasing the chance of missing the ball.
definitions.example: Don't swing for the fences unless it's an easy ball; be content with running part way.

definitions.definition: To do something extremely ambitious, especially rashly.
definitions.example: I'm not going to swing for the fences tomorrow, but I'm hoping my speech will be warmly received.

definitions.definition: A sheet of paper or cardboard with a written or printed announcement on one side for display in a public place.
A public proclamation; a manifesto or edict issued by authority.
Permission given by authority; a license.
definitions.example: to give a placard to do something

definitions.definition: An extra plate on the lower part of the breastplate or backplate of armour.
A kind of stomacher, often adorned with jewels, worn in the fifteenth century and later.
The woodwork and frame of the door of a closet etc.
To affix a placard to.
To announce with placards.
definitions.example: to placard a sale

definitions.definition: To grow or become white
definitions.example: His cheek blanched with fear.

definitions.definition: To take the color out of, and make white; to bleach
definitions.example: Age has blanched his hair.

definitions.definition: To cook by dipping briefly into boiling water, then directly into cold water.
To whiten, for example the surface of meat, by plunging into boiling water and afterwards into cold, so as to harden the surface and retain the juices
To bleach by excluding the light, for example the stalks or leaves of plants, by earthing them up or tying them together
To make white by removing the skin of, for example by scalding
definitions.example: to blanch almonds

definitions.definition: To give a white lustre to (silver, before stamping, in the process of coining)
(tntransitive) To cover (sheet iron) with a coating of tin.
To give a favorable appearance to; to whitewash; to whiten;
To avoid, as from fear; to evade; to leave unnoticed.
To cause to turn aside or back.
definitions.example: to blanch a deer

definitions.definition: To use evasion.
Rugby
Rugby player
Power derived from the motion of a horse.
A non-metric unit of power (symbol hp) with various definitions, for different applications. The most common of them is probably the mechanical horsepower, approximately equal to 745.7 watts.
A metric unit (symbol often PS from the German abbreviation), approximately equal to 735.5 watts.
Strength.
definitions.example: political horsepower
